revised_title: A New Crinoid Species from the Southern Sea: Thaumatocrinus Renovatus
tldr: The author discovers a new crinoid species, Thaumatocrinus renovatus, from the Southern Sea, featuring unique characteristics such as a closed ring of basals, separation of radials by interradial plates, and a jointed arm-like appendage on the anal side. This species is distinct from other known crinoids and provides valuable insights into the evolution and classification of these marine creatures.
